Name: Gary Gómez Bastida
Description:
Gary was a lawyer who worked in the Prosecutor's Office of the Attorney General's Office. Her body was found on the Mexico-Querétaro highway at km 61.7, near the municipality of Tepeji del Río.

Investigators indicated that her murder was committed by two men, one of whom was arrested shortly afterwards.

> José Manuel González Corona was captured on Friday when he was driving aboard a Dodge Atos car in the vicinity of the victim's home in the Juventino Rosas neighborhood.
> 
> In his statement, he explained that after a discussion his accomplice - still a fugitive - hit Gómez Bastida with a bat on the head and then left her body on the road.

> The director of the LGTB Agenda collective, Jaime López Vela, said that the work of Gómez Bastida in favor of the sexual diversity groups was outstanding and important, in addition to working for the recognition of the rights of the lesbian-gay community in the Mexico City.
> 
> From her position, Gary assumed herself as a transsexual woman in the process of sex-gender reassignment and invited the authorities and the staff in her charge to learn about the subject in order to offer better care to users and avoid acts of discrimination. She repeatedly declared that she was working to build a culture of non-discrimination in the pursuit of justice, in order to ensure "that all of us who are part of sexual diversity can express ourselves".

TvT partner organization Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans www.notiese.org 07.06.2013

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found alongside the BR-304 highway in the early hours of Sunday 9th June. Her identity is unknown.

> In the early hours of this Sunday (09/06/2013), in the city of Macaíba on BR 304 near the vilar walkway, a body of a [trans woman] was found by car 1114, with the characteristic of hanging as her body was found with a rope around the neck. The name of the victim is not yet known as she carried no documents, but it is known that she was 13 years old and lives in rural Macaíba.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Cabuloso, 09.06.2013

Name: O. Nascimento Valadares
Description:
O. was found dead dressed only in her underwear on rua Jose Maria de Lacerda in the Industrial City neighborhood of Contagem in the early hours of Wednesday 12th June. She had been shot in the face.

> A friend of the victim spoke with the police and said she saw Valadares for the last time at around 3am leaving with a client in a white Fiat Fiorino. In addition, the friend said that Valadares had a black handbag, which was not found at the scene. It is possible she was robbed by her killer.

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & O tempo Cidades 12.06.2013

Name: (Darko) Vujanovic
Description:
The victim was stabbed 10 times. The NGO Gayten LGBT reports that the arrested suspect was a client of the victim. The murder was preceded by a fight about paying for sex services.

TvT partner organization Gayten LGBT & In Serbia Info 21.06.2013

Name: Franciele Gomes da Silva
Description:
Franciele was shot in the head in front of her apartment by an assailant who was waiting for her to return home and escaped with an accomplice on a motorcycle.

> A 33-year-old [woman] was shot dead Monday night in the center of Rondonópolis, 218 kilometers from Cuiabá. According to the Military Police, the victim was [transgender] and was shot in the head on the way home, around 11 pm [Mato Grosso time].

TvT partner organization Grupo Gay da Bahia & Olha Direito 25.06.2013
